title: Typographic sightseeing in NYC?
content:
Hello.

My first of (hopefully) many posts here at Typophile.

Now, I’m travelling to New York City in mid-August and I was wondering if any of you know any good/interesting/educational typographic-related museums/locations/companies etc around that time. 18-26 of August to be more precise.

Thank you.

 [‹ Interesting page about typographer's handwritings](http://web.archive.org/web/20080925134017/http:/typophile.com/node/47259 "Go to previous forum topic") [What is the Singstar PS3 interface font ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080925134017/http:/typophile.com/node/47260 "Go to next forum topic")
author: sargen

comments.content:
It looks like the [Type Directors Club](http://web.archive.org/web/20080925134017/http:/www.tdc.org/) will be closed during August.

But there is also the New York [Center for Book Arts](http://web.archive.org/web/20080925134017/http:/www.centerforbookarts.org/).

Both the [AIGA](http://web.archive.org/web/20080925134017/http:/www.aigany.org/) and the [Art Directors Club](http://web.archive.org/web/20080925134017/http:/www.adcglobal.org/) usually have some type of exhibit on their premises.

Don’t miss this great exhibition of three (yes, three) Gutenberg bibles at the [The Morgan Library & Museum](http://web.archive.org/web/20080925134017/http:/www.themorgan.org/exhibitions/exhibition.asp?id=7).

There is also the [Herb Lubalin Study Center of Design and Typography](http://web.archive.org/web/20080925134017/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Herb%252BLubalin%252BStudy%252BCenter%252Bof%252BDesign%252Band%252BTypography), located within Cooper Union. It’s by appointment only, and they have a limited schedule during the summer, but it is [worth it](http://web.archive.org/web/20080925134017/http:/www.underconsideration.com/speakup/archives/004949.html)!
